NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}],"EnumerableMapNonexistentKey(bytes32)":[{"details":"Query for a nonexistent map key."}],"InvalidInitialization()":[{"details":"The contract is already initialized."}],"NotInitializing()":[{"details":"The contract is not initializing."}],"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized reentrant call."}]},"events":{"Initialized(uint64)":{"details":"Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized."},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"activateValidator(address)":{"params":{"validator":"Address of the validator to activate"}},"closeRebalanceRequests(address,address[])":{"details":"Clears the rebalance requests and triggers redelegation through stakingManager","params":{"stakingManager":"Address of the staking manager contract","validators":"Array of validator addresses"}},"constructor":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow":"constructor"},"deactivateValidator(address)":{"params":{"validator":"Address of the validator to deactivate"}},"getDelegation(address)":{"params":{"stakingManager":"Address of the staking manager"},"returns":{"_0":"Address of the validator to delegate to"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information."},"getRoleMemberCount(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role."},"getRoleMembers(bytes32)":{"details":"Return all accounts that have `role` WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasPendingRebalance(address)":{"params":{"validator":"Address of the validator to check"},"returns":{"_0":"bool True if the validator has a pending rebalance request"}},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize(address,address,address,address)":{"params":{"_oracle":"Address that will have oracle role","_pauserRegistry":"Address of the pauser registry contract","admin":"Address that will have admin role","manager":"Address that will have manager role"}},"reactivateValidator(address)":{"params":{"validator":"Address of the validator to reactivate"}},"rebalanceWithdrawal(address,address[],uint256[])":{"params":{"stakingManager":"Address of the staking manager contract","validators":"Array of validator addresses","withdrawalAmounts":"Array of amounts to withdraw"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"reportRewardEvent(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount of rewards for the validator","validator":"Address of the validator to be rewarded"}},"reportSlashingEvent(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"Amount to slash from the validator","validator":"Address of the validator to be slashed"}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. params.validator: Address of the validator to activate

closeRebalanceRequests(address,address[].details: Clears the rebalance requests and triggers redelegation through stakingManager

params.stakingManager: Address of the staking manager contract

params.validator: Address of the validator to deactivate

returns._0: Address of the validator to delegate to

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

getRoleMembers(bytes32).details: Return all accounts that have `role` WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params.validator: Address of the validator to check

returns._0: bool True if the validator has a pending rebalance request

params._oracle: Address that will have oracle role
params._pauserRegistry: Address of the pauser registry contract
params.admin: Address that will have admin role
params.manager: Address that will have manager role

params.validator: Address of the validator to reactivate

params.stakingManager: Address of the staking manager contract

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.amount: Amount of rewards for the validator
params.validator: Address of the validator to be rewarded

params.amount: Amount to slash from the validator
params.validator: Address of the validator to be slashed

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.validator: Address of the validator to delegate to

MANAGER_ROLE().notice: Role that can manage validators and operational parameters

ORACLE_MANAGER_ROLE().notice: Role that can update validator performance

activateValidator(address).notice: Activate a new validator in the system

closeRebalanceRequests(address,address[].notice: Close multiple rebalance requests and redelegate

delegations(address).notice: Mapping of staking manager to delegation target

getDelegation(address).notice: Get delegation target for a staking manager

hasPendingRebalance(address).notice: Check if a validator has a pending rebalance request

initialize(address,address,address,addre.notice: Initialize the contract with initial configuration

reportRewardEvent(address,uint256).notice: Report a reward event for a validator

reportSlashingEvent(address,uint256).notice: Report a slashing event for a validator

setDelegation(address,address).notice: Set delegation target for a staking manager

totalSlashing().notice: Total amount slashed across all validators

updateValidatorPerformance(address,uint2.notice: Updates performance scores for a validator

validatorAt(uint256).notice: Gets validator info at a specific index

validatorCount().notice: Gets the total number of validators

validatorInfo(address).notice: Gets validator info for a specific address

validatorPerformance(address).notice: Mapping of validator to performance report

validatorRebalanceRequests(address).notice: Mapping of validator to rebalance request

validatorRewards(address).notice: Mapping of validator to total rewards

validatorSlashing(address).notice: Mapping of validator to total slashing amount
